reviews.text: I was truly disappointed with the resort. I was looking forward to a nice vacation at the beach... but the apartment was smelly, noisy and beware of bedbugs!! Overall not quite the experience I was looking for.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: I recently stayed at Litchfield Beach and Golf Resort for a long girls' weekend. I booked here because the resort was running a special for the new hotel, Summerhouse. The resort has several hotels and condos for rent. Summerhouse was the newest, featuring one bedroom with 2 Q beds, living room with pullout sofabed, full kitchen(with dishes and utensils incuded) and beautiful bathroom. The hotel was very quiet, could not even hear our neighbors. The pool was very close by, nice and clean. There was a shuttle to the beach every 10-20 minutes, and it was only a 10 minute walk to beach. Having Starbucks just a few steps away was awesome!! I would recommend this resort to anyone and everyone....families with children, singles, couples, etc. There is something here for everyone.
reviews.title: beautiful resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is OK. We paid $130 total to spend one night. This place is a step below what my husband and I have become accustomed to. Our room was your standard hotel room. On the back of the building in which we stayed you can see screened in balconies however our room didn't have a balcony on it? I"m not quite sure how or why that is, and I don't remember that being an option on the web site..to pay more for a room with a balcony?
reviews.title: One Step Below

reviews.text: This place is called the Sea Side Inn, however it is at least a 10-15 minute walk to the beach, or you can stand in the 100 degree weather and wait for a shuttle to show up and drive you to the beach. We ate at Webster's, the restaurant on the resort. It was nice, not cheap, but the food was good.
reviews.title: Great family resort

reviews.text: The pool area was very nice and saved the vacation.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from another great stay at Litchfield. This was the second time we stayed at the Seaside Inn (really is'nt seaside) and it was still as clean and quiet as we remembered. We stayed in a Villa last year which was really great but wanted to save money this year (saved $300-400 for the week). Our full kitchen in the Inn was well appointed and the washer and dryer are a must. The beds were comfy and the screened porch was nice. The bathroom is the best! It is nice and big with seperate bath and shower. The tub is huge; so nice and relaxing after a day on the beach. As always the beach was uncrowded and the children enjoyed tidal pools every day. We always recommend Litchfield to anyone with children as there are great pools inside and out and you are away from the crowd in Myrtle Beach.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.text: We really loved this place. We stayed at a condo across the street *on HWY 17* from the beach. We stayed there 2 times in the past few years. It s anice place to stay to relax. You can rent golf carts to get around or go across the street to the beach and its really beautiful and its not far from Myrtle Beach. It s close to everything, food stores, attractions, shops, beachs, resturants, etc.
reviews.title: Loved this place

reviews.text: This is a good place for families and retirements too.
reviews.title: Worst Room ever

reviews.text: We have returned from our summer vacation at Litchfield Beach & Golf Resort on 8/9/08. I waited 10 days to calm down as I was sorely disappointed and upset in the accommodations we were given. I scoured the internet for a nice place to stay and selected what I thought would be a nice place to stay. Unfortunately, my experience will speak for itself. When I called the resort directly to make the reservation, the agent assured me the room would be a certain floor plan with very nice furnishings. When we arrived on 8/2/08, the room was not the floor plan we chose from the internet and furnishings were in poor shape, the mattresses were in need of replacement, the room did not smell clean. Later in the evening when the first shower was taken, the shower did not drain properly and I called maintenance to fix it. When the second person showered, the shower did not drain properly. This scenario went on for days. I called and complained again. On the last night of our stay, a very nice staff member offered to put us in another room. We left some of our belongings in the original room, so on the morning of our departure at 6AM ET, I went to retrieve our belongings and found the room was flooded from the shower/bathtub drainage problem with "dirty" water streaming over the tub into the kitchen and front room. I can't express how annoyed and upset I was with this resort. I want to comment about the staff at the resort to say they must have been trained to empathize but have no power to change anything wrong. Furthermore, there was not much of an attempt to set things right.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great TIme

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Beach Colony for the last 10 years and decided that we wanted to move south and we're glad we did. We spent 6 days at the Bridgewater and my family and I had a great time. Perfect location for doing nothing but sitting on the beach and going to nice restaurants which is exactly what we wanted to do. The room was nice and clean and the Resort staff was friendly and helpful. We were also able to check in at 2:00 PM (not 4:00). That gave us almost another full afternoon on the beach. Murrells Inlet is close by for the best food on the strand. We'll be going back again next year.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Litchfield Beach & Golf Resort for a 4 day / 3 night getaway this month. We were recommended to Litchfield by a family friend, who said it was the perfect place for families to vacation on the beach. She was right!
reviews.title: Stay Away from Bridgewater

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay at Litchfield Beach & Golf Resort due to it's location, near outstanding golf courses and away from the congested areas. HOWEVER, while our 1-bedroom suite at Seaside was clean it was MOST UNCOMFORTABLE. The beds were the worst! Also, the sofa and chairs in the living area were not designed for comfort and relaxation. The TV was small, old and did not have HBO, Demand or anything other than local channels. For a resort this is most unusual and definately disappointing. The kitchen/dining area were fine and the bath very nice. I don't care what the price, while it was reasonable since it was off season and the ecomy is bad, the place needs to be comfortable and it wasn't. Also, the indoor pool and facilities (a necessity during the cooler weather) was small and outdated. The pool depth was shown as 3 1/2 to 4 1/2 feet, but the water was at least a foot below the water line with no one in the pool. The photo of the indoor pool area is most deceptive. There was nothing that reflected "resort" during this stay. I suggest selecting another place to stay.
reviews.title: Pick another place to stay

reviews.text: We had such a great time there! We loved it so much we went again a couple of months later and took our friends! Beds, views, pools, location, staff all were wonderful. We have praised to everyone we know and so did our friends. As we basked ourselves on the beach we made a deal to return again.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: I emailed several times & got someone that wouldn't answer my question (which rooms are ocean view-unclear on website) so I booked online after speaking w/ the agent to make sure that the room I was picking was the best one for me. I specifically wanted a king size bed & ocean view so we booked the 2 bedroom suite for $300 more even though it was just me & my husband so that we could have plenty of room to stretch. I made sure there wasn't a cheaper option w/ a king size for ocean view before spending the extra money. Wouldn't you know it, we get into the room and it has 2 full size beds in each room and no king size anywhere. The couch had springs sticking in your back- not at all comfortable. I called down to have them give me the room advertized on the website (shows a king size bed on the website) but they didn't have one available. We had to push the beds together to sleep together (I'm pregnant so a crack in my back was a real treat). The excuse I got from the front desk was that I shouldn't have booked on line because what is shown is not accurate. I'll say! I thought I'd have a great room but that is clearly not what I got! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who will actually use it or want to be comforable.
reviews.title: poor customer service & repeated lack of responses to giving us wrong room

likes.liked: — lazy river was neat but very warm (and suspitiously yellow)

reviews.text: BEST PLACE TO STAY!! I highly recommend it! Everyone is so friendly and nice to deal with! Beaches and close and clean!
reviews.title: Feels like home!

reviews.text: Where do I begin? Pictures looked great on the website. We rented a 2 bedroom duplex for 5 nights. We were told by the staff it was a 2 bedroom house not a duplex you share with another set of renters with paper thin walls. I'm sure they were just as happy as we were! If you like mold, roaches, spiders, and fire ants this is the place for you. It severly needs a renovation. The furniture, curtains, and bedspreads looked like they were new in the 80's. Not to mention the mattress. None of the remotes had batteries and the DVD player in the second bedroom was broken. All of the dishes in the cabinets had to be washed before we could use them. The shower curtains had mold growing on them. Ok, now the pool. It also looked great on the internet. Lazy river, a submarine for the kids to play in and a hot tub for the adults. Too bad it was covered in fire ants. I mean covered! Every chair, every table, every inch of concrete. It was finally addressed by the third day we were there. The staff told us before we rented it was easy to get from Lakeside to the beach. A golf cart shuttle would carry us from our duplex to the beach. Now the truth. First you carry all your stuff and the kids a quarter of a mile to the closest golf cart stop. You wait for 30+ minutes and a broken down golf cart shows up. This was the good part. They did not mention this service was only on the weekend. The rest of the time you drive your self in your own car. Needless to say we enjoyed our time with the family on vacation, but we will not go back to Litchfield.
reviews.title: Stay Away From Lakside 65B
